title: How to end a letter to someone you don't know - Quora

response.answer_text: Ending a letter has become more relaxed than when I was young. We use to say sincerely or cordially and sign our name. Now people say things like “Hope to hear from you soon” or “stay well” and then they sign their name.

If you don't know the name of person you're sending a letter to, you should start the letter with "To Whom it may Concern. Follow this with the reason for the letter. You can end the letter with “Thank you" or “Sincerely”.
